review_data.content:
Nice place with very good chill out ambience.

Korean food fusion style, although we were deep down expecting authentic one with punch of spiciness.

Food are great, prepared after our order. We waited about 20 mins. Staff are polite and service is good. They came over a few times checking on us. Every dish served the staff will tell us how to enjoy them.
Awesome place to visit, has incredible decorations. The food it’s really tasty. The workers are very nice especially Helmi. We will make sure too came back another day.

I visited it on a Friday night with some friends and it was quite crowded. We had few starters and they were quite nice. I loved their sides and dips as well.
I ordered the vegetarian bibibmap and it was delicious - the portion size on the higher end and I could not finish it completely!
They have a good range of vegan and vegetarian options - so it is a good place to try authentic flavours.

Decoration, ambience and drinks were really good. Giving 2.5 stars however as the tofu and cauliflower were obviously fried a few hours ago. Arrived table at room temperature, hard. Even the fries came at slightly warmer than room temperature, slightly soggy. Tofu had to be sent back as it was hard, but they were nice enough to replace it with a fresh batch.

Came at 15:00, at not a busy time so it is a shame because the food would've tasted so so good if they bothered to cook them freshly.
Ordered two cocktails without alcohol and two starters for New Year's eve. The quality and delicacy of food is awesome !

Elegant & Beautiful restaurant with some delicious Korean dishes with a twist. The iron pots are my new favorite! It has also some really delicious plant based stuff… like a bulgogi (don’t remember the whole dish name!) and a fried cauliflower that doesn’t make you miss at all the chicken! The desserts are quite cool too. Shaved ice with Oreo is Simply delicious, and really fresh if you’re full… and if you fancy to go all the way, the marshmallow bbq won’t disappoint you! I was with my friends and we all loved it. We’ll be back :)

We visited this place for lunch.

Even though we had a reservation, we had to wait for 5 minutes to have the COVID certificates checked and be seated (behind us around 6-7 people were queuing as well).

We then waited for more than 25 minutes for someone to take us the order for drinks.
We left without having the chance to order dessert and coffee because no one was coming to our table.

I tried to call three different waiters , they all smiled at me and passed by. Thanks for being polite, but I wasn't looking for a smile back.

I had the ramen which was mediocre. I am not planning on visiting this place again.

I’ve come here twice now during lunchtime and went with the Bibimbap both times. The Bibimbap dishes come in a “hot bowl”, allowing the food to fry right in front of you, thus staying hot till the end. Perfect for slow eaters like myself 😅

The second time, I opted for the veggie option “bibimbap of the day” with a nice variety of mushrooms!

The friends who came were also very happy with their orders (fried chicken bowl and korean fried chicken).

The waiter was even kind enough to bring something we requested which wasn’t on the lunch menu!

Plenty of options also for vegans.

Look Föteli to come again for dinner to try other menu items too!
I like the ambiance of this place. The food was good with reasonable price. Service was great.
Amazing restaurant and excellent food quality. We really enjoyed our time! Until next time!

As a Korean, I do not recommend "fried chicken" & "chicken burger" here. I visited twice and both were NOT a good experience. My first visit last year was OK with ordering the 'beef bibimbop' but the fried chicken was not at all nice. In the recent second try, I ordered "fried chicken" again, but as seen in the pictures, it was overly greasy and too crispy -- it hurt my mouth. The sauce on top of the chicken was a mere taste of 'Gochujang (Korean red pepper paste)' -- this was not an authentic Korean chicken sauce. Look at the burger in the picture... it is a nonsense to put the pickled radish as is into the burger -- this made it burger too juicy (runny) and fall apart. The chicken in the burger was also too crispy. Even with 50% discount (Monday coupon), I felt it was not worthy.

A very mediocre Asian restaurant. While for Swiss standards it might be great, if you've had good Asian food, you'd be disappointed.

I ordered ramen and it came with a chunk of uncooked noodles.

We had a Bentobox and Korean Fried Chicken. The food was yummy. We didn‘t have to wait long for the food at all, which is great for lunchbreaks. Our server Helmi was very friendly and made sure everything was alright.
Very delicious fries 🍟 and the homemade drinks were so refreshing. Interior truly blended my eyes and i would definitely go back again. Love it!
Korean resto very close to Zurich central train station. The Bibimbap during lunch is good. They have Soju and Makgeolli too 😜

A very hip and urban restaurant with high ceiling, modern, edgy decor, open kitchen, huge space. However, the flavors are not good, the Gim Bab is too small portion for the price and too much sauce, ramen is served with raw veggie, which we don't do,  beef buigogki is okay, fried chicken meat is not flavorful enough. Drinks were good though. So we were quite disappointed with our dinner.

Location: it's a 5 minute walk to the main train station. The design is super fancy and really cool. But the tables are super close to the neighbors, which made me feel very uncomfortable.

Staff: hectic, but friendly

Menu: they have a huge variety on Korean dishes. Go for the hit stone bowl with egg/beef/salad. That's was absolutely amazing. As a desert I can highly recommend the Marshmallow Bonfire.

Bathroom: it was like s little disco in there! And also, there is a little surprised, once you exit the bathroom. Go and check it out - and bring a camera!!!

Nice Food and Housemade Tea,
Amazing Atmosphere, you need to do a reservation. :)

Very nice! There are lots of clearly labelled vegan options, and everything we tried was super tasty. They were very nice and gave us a corner table because we had two dogs with us, and both dogs got a bowl of water.

Came here as a group of 6. Service was slooooow took a long time to get our orders in, but the restaurant was filling fast so this is understandable. The waiter was very friendly. The food and drinks come out FAST. I don’t even know how it’s possible to have 6 cocktails come out to the table in under 5 minutes but it was truly that fast. Amazing. The food came out just as fast. We didn’t try dessert but just gives us an excuse to come back. Highly recommend!
Beautifully decorated  korean Restaurant.  Has the best funkiest toilet, feather swing ,lady disco theme toilet.  The food is morden korean , fried chicken burger,  pork belly ramen etc etc. 😋 nice

I remember vividly when Miss Miu opened and my disappointment when it turned out they don’t have almost any vegan friendly options. Luckily, this has changed and now it’s one of my fav places in Zürich. I’m absolutely crazy about their rich and well balanced tantanmen ramen (Bunsan Deluxe), their kimchi soup (Nosan Night). Their iron pots (boiling your soup on the stove directly on your table) are a very nice experience for Asian cuisine loves and  novices alike. I didn’t enjoy Yunai Sky bulgogi that much, not sure if it’s because I had it for take away and it lost its temperature or is it the dish itself. I’d recommend trying their house crafted drinks (in cold refreshers section), I enjoyed Phoenix & Passion. Restroom on the floor below, accessible through stairs (I haven’t seen the elevator or other amenities to accommodate those with limited mobility, unfortunately).

Sorely disappointed after high expectations. The burger was unbelievably and undeniably dry. Under all those breadcrumbs and batter there was next to no chicken. After a few mouthfuls of dry fried batter I gave up. I told the waiter that the burger was far too dry and he just said ‘okay’. Few minutes later he brought me a glass of tap water - that’s sweet but hardly going to remedy all that money spent on an uneaten dry burger. The beef bao buns were completely uninspiring. I wouldn’t go back and nor would I recommend Miss Miu.

service was ok but the fries next to my fried chicken were so stale and really needed the sauce that barely came with it. The fried chicken needed to be drenched in the spicy sauce, otherwise was pretty flavorless average fried chicken. slightly too expensive for the meal.

It seems employees don't have a hygienic concept. I got a bug inside of my dessert and then I told to an employee and he said “ tell the others not me” and he left. It makes me feel like that I don't want to finish my plate and I just wanted to leave this place so I asked for a bill and the other employee came with the bill and I said I can't pay the dessert because there was a bug and I can't eat it“ and then she went like “you already eat it so you have to pay”...... Yes, I had 2 bites and then there was a bug... How can I recognize that there was a bug inside of it without touching it..... Anyhow I just paid and left because I just don't want to talk to them anymore and already lost the desire to eat
And they never say sorry... It was a regretful and disappointing choice here.

We came early to have dinner and they placed us next to another couple! The other table was so close that we could step our feet to each others… The meat of the Bun was so dry that it seems it has been cooked ages ago, also the ramen had about 80% noodles and 20% almost no soup! Didnt have a great experience
Decent taste but overpriced and portions too small. The service was also not overly friendly. Location is great though and the deco is super cool. Would take very little to improve it.
Food was good and tasty but I had the feeling that my portion was smaller as the one from the next table...
Good food! Bingsu is not recommendable 😉 freid Chicken is nice

Absoluty isn't the Korean taste!!!
BBQ Korean??? Never

I would not recommen....

Delicious food and great service! We had the Korean BBQ and I really loved the cucumber kimchi. Our server Vijay did a great job at taking care of us all night and we thoroughly enjoyed it! Thank you :)
Foods taste very good. (I am from Korea) It was so crowded and it might need more staffs to deal with it.
Fun vibe and welcoming atmosphere. The fried chicken was dry and it seems it hasn't been freshly prepared. Better get chicken nuggets at McD and order other stuff here.

Nice Personal, very very good food! also an easy to reach location. I couldn't finish the food bc it was too much and they gave it to me to take home without me asking for! The prices ate amazing to the size of the plates! really can recommend that place!! immer wieder gern!!!!!!
Finally I found good korean food in the heart of Zurich. Gluten free and veggie options available. Super good service. I'll be back for sure!

Seems like the food quality is a frequent topic in the reviews here already. Unfortunately I have to double down on this. We got food poisoning from delivery.. You can argue about taste, but food safety and hygiene is no joke. Irritating that they’re asking for second chances in previous replies, but don’t seem to improve much.

This place is incredibly beautiful decorated! Nice atmosphere, good music vibes! Perfect place to meet up with friends and family. They've lot of food selection and drinks! If you like Korean food or a good selfie place. This restaurant is probably one of the best place to visit. I've enjoyed all the food on the table, and it was really tasty....love it xxx

I visited here for shave ice several times and the taste was nice. So, l went here for trying fried chicken this time but it was not really great. First of all, I could clearly feel that chicken was not fresh (taste, smell, and texture were exactly same with refried chicken kept in refrigerator for few days). Second problem is hygiene. I think this is the most important for all restaurants. From my table, I could clearly see the inside of kitchen and working people. Some of them were not wearing gloves. They touched everywhere (even one of them scratched his hair), and then touched salad and put on plates which were served to people. And also, one of them wasn’t wear a facial mask and kept talking while he was preparing food. When we consider this is Covid period, It is both dangerous and dirty.

So, I don’t recommend this korean restaurant as a korean.

Such good food! I had 3 starters which was enough for me, my friends had burger and iron pot. We all loved our food! Big up for the cauliflower and the mandus! Also the ginger lemon homemade tea was just what we needed on this cold day!

Searching for places to eat in the local area and this place popped up. I don’t normally leave reviews but I feel compelled as the food was absolutely exquisite.

Delicious high quality plates, selection of foods and drinks (Bibimbap & Summer Breeze) and an excellent and efficient service from Helmi.We tried all their entrees, one of their desserts, and everything was de-li-cious. Highly recommended.Legitimately the best restaurant around in Zurich without a doubt.Doesn’t matter what I get I end up liking it.

The whole experience from start to finish is great waiter (Helmi) is always so friendly and kind. I love the service at the place and Helmi is so friendly with the guests and always takes care to offer the best quality! I highly recommend this place.

I cannot recommend this place enough! Such a warm and welcoming environment! I am definitely going back.

-Fauzi-

Warning - the restaurant is not accepting covid certification from other counties, so if you have tourist/visitors with you, forget it.. Particularly, very unfriendly person in the reception, made us wait and then eventually rejected the covid certificate that is recognised in the airport, and in the restaurants nearby. Congratulations to you STEFANO, you made it to the hall of shame! Shame on you!!! You need more training on customer service!

Very disappointed. Cooked meat for barbecue, tasteless kimchi and we had to ask every 5 minutes for vegetables. The rice from menu was also forgotten.
The barbecue table is way too small for 12 peoples, quite uncomfortable especially when your neighbors are strangers.
Ginger aperol was too sweet. Only good things were the friendly service and central location.

The best thing about the restaurant is its cool interior design. Staff is helpful, drinks delicious & original (Gin Tonic!!).
The meals look better than they taste, our chicken was dry, portions rather small for the price.
BBQ was one huge chaos, not Asian at all (rather a bacon on raclette...). We waited 15 minutes for one drink and than cancelled the order.

Finally open again! Delicious Korean food in the middle of Europaallee. Bibimbap variations yummy and despite visiting frequently one doesn’t have to repeat. Angry fried chicken and the fried cauliflower are highly recommended. Best angry fried chicken around.
Drinks are served in quiet unique glasses - the Hibiskus Prosecco is insta worthy.
Very good food, nice staff and a lot of vegan options !
Although more on the expensive side, I really do like the chicken they offer her. Lovely staff, tasty food, not much to complain about
Good food overall, very loosely based on Korean food, so don’t expect authenticity.

Don’t even bother to give it another try. Bibimbap is not supposed to be a ton of oil on the bottom soaked with rice ( pot was totally not hot enough to make a bibimbap. And served with beetroot is like serving Kimchi on Rösti....and the Rösti is soaked in the oil undone.

It was very Tasty and a very Nice Location~
It had super nice Desserts, the drinks were super tasty and the food was Incredible :3

Helmi was a very Kind and Nice Waitresser, It was fun to talk to him and he was always there when we needed something~ He seemed Cheerful and Motivated too, that gave me a good impression :) Will come again for sure!
Delicious food, nice ambiance and tip top service from Helmi !! ❤️❤️❤️ What an experience!

This is such a top place to eat out! The food does not only taste fantastic but is greatly presented.
Really enjoyed a dinner there and could not resist coming there a week later for another dinner.

First impression of the place was great. Very stylist and modern. Expectation was very high for this place. Indeed the food was very fine. Would certainly go back to try other stuff. And  one of the staff, Mark deserves a promotion. He was very friendly and attentive!
Very good decoration food and ambience. Edit: today there are too many people and the restaurant can’t handle it. Also the person at the door is a bit impolite

lovely atmosphere, good service, great food!
They had some delicious vegetarian and vegan options. Looking forward to try more food.

The food was good and the service was great.

Unfortunately, I left the restaurant with my hair and clothes stinking of food. They might have issues with ventilation.

Overall disappointed, the service was not professionel, you have to call them again and again, boring. The quality of food is pretty poor, no taste and rather for Western nose, who does not know Korean kitchen. If you like authentic Korean cuisine, you better go to Akaraka, close to Stauffacher. I would not recommend Miss Miu. Another modern Restaurant in Zurich, where you don't go twice.

Good atmosphere inside and is a nice place to be. However the food was a little bland and having been in Zurich for a while there are nicer korean/pan Asian restaurants around. I got the Korean fried chicken and would expected more sauce with it. It felt like I was eating a very expensive KFC.
The vegan iron pot was totally tasteless ( tofu was the most tasty thing in the soup ). Service was distracted, unhelpful, and very confused. Long time to ask them anything.

Nice staff, mediocre food, confusing concept: Don't expect a Korean restaurant, this looks more like the outcome of commercially motivated choices.

First off, kudos to the staff for being friendly.

This place is decorated with a seemingly wild mix of photography (weirdly enough, of Japanese streets), Korean letters, fake plants, cheesy vintage chandeliers, clumsy monochrome illustrations of 20s bourlesque dancers and trendy nordic furniture — presumably all under the excuse of "fusion", and an attempt at being hip. But the result is a regrettable lack of character and authenticity.

While the drinks were enjoyable and pretty, our food was not worth the bill. The "vegetarian noodles" were just meat-less, which basically meant that there was nothing besides sauce and a few flakes (the 'scallions' mentioned in the menu) garnishing the noodles. A dish very similar to a portion of instant noodles, but for tenfold the price. The half cooked vinegar egg was a nice touch though.

I don't know the story and motivations behind this restaurant's foundation, and it seems like they try really hard: Unfortunately the end product felt like a shallow and calculated business choice in a new central district, using Korean cuisine as a marketable shell without any heart or real love for it.

Miss Miu is a very good Korean BBQ Restaurant.

The Restaurant has various parts;
- a take away corner, with digital ordering panels.
- the normal restaurant with a high roof and nice decorations
- a open kitchen, where you see the chefs do their art
- a small Bar with some seats
- and last but not least in the back of the Restaurant there are some Teppanyaki tables, where you can heat your own ordered food.

Thr Staff is very friendly and helpful. But a little slow because they do not actively watch their guest, so you have to wave your hands or make a inconspicuous stunt to get their attention.

The price is ok for a restaurant based so near to the center of Zürich.
The starters where CHF 11.50 - CHF 13.50
The Spae Ribs CHF 34.50 (Special Dish of the week)
The Haeundae Surf CHF 29.50
Desserts where arround CHF 9.50 - CHF 12.50

I can really recommend this restaurant. I will be there again soon.
Nice Korean food for fair prices. They have plenty of vegetarian options and good homemade lemonade :)

I loved the ambience in here and the cocktails are good. The food looked and smelled great I’ll definitely be back to try!

Edit went back to taste the food and it did not disappoint. The service was excellent too.

The food was good, but one of the waiter was really aggressive to us. I asked for a copy of the bill, and he said you should told me earlier, and daaaa I told him I need a receipt even before paying and he was really rude. Every place on check out ask you if you need a copy or not !!!

I ordered Gugudan O‘clock, my husband had the Hanok Stay (it was not a WOW but OK)  and Hyundai-ok. The food that they served was NOT WARM ENOUGH almost caold! The Hyundai-ok tastes good- but the buns itself was not warm at all. The Gugudan O‘clock was awful, the noodles I got with my soup was unevenly cooked, some parts were still RAW, soup wasn’t warm. The waiter was kind enough to replace it but I have already lost my appetite. It’s sad as we were there to supposedly enjoy the weekend but the experience was not so nice and to be honest it was just a waste of money. Never again! 👎🏾

The restaurant is very busy with a lot of customers but that cannot be an excuse for a poor service. Not satisfied with the way our waiter took our orders unprofessionaly, should not have happened in a such high rated restaurant. Also the food did not standed up as good to be called KoreanCuisine everything was bland and no taste. A let down..

Having eaten Korean Barbacue many times in Korea and all around the world, I can honestly say this was very very disappointing.  Firstly the meat cuts - no short ribs, the pork belly was low level pork belly, 3 slices of meat (the meat again was completely wrong - it should have more fat in it - this is was like a SWISS TISCHGRILL !

Sides - this was the most disappointing - the tiniest sides dishes of Kimchi for two people, mushrooms ????, no spring onions, aubergine ???? , no radishes, complete lack of vegetables ( and no knowledge by the waiter of what was even on the table ) no perilla - and again what was on the table was so so so tiny dishes circa 5-6 cm - we had to keep asking ( for which the waiter did not want to bring  even the most basic like lettuce - of which was mixed quality ).

The bill came to 350 fr and for the amount of money charged,  the quality of the food, the amount served and the fact is was not even an attempt to be original.  Location is good, interior is ok but this is not Korean BBQ - this is at worst a low-level tisch grill.

Highly unrecommended, highly unoriginal, highly expensive.
A bit expensive for what it is. Food was ok but not for 30chf

Pros: The ambience and the staff

Cons: It's not really a Korean restaurant, it's a fusion restaurant and u can taste it. The Bibimbap, was just okay, first they served the wrong meat and then they removed the wrong meat and replaced it with right the meat, which made the raw egg already become cooked. The portion was in general to small for the price. The Bingsu was also very small and was also just okay a lot with whip cream, first time seeing whip cream on a Bingsu.

Overall not sure if I will come back again, there are better Korean places out in Zurich. First time I was not full after Bibimbap and Bingsu. Also we didn't get the complimentary pickles, not sure if it's BC we were to early or not, but pickles would have been nice with the Bibimbap.

Had their lunch bento box. Good portion for the price. Spicy crisp chicken could be more spicy though... Loved their free kimchi (proper korean way!) and shaved ice. Nice atmosphere. One of my favorite Korean restaurants in town.
Not the best korean I ate, the portions were small and the prices were really high. The location is cute tho!

I’m super disappointed from this restaurant! Awful service! My ramen soup came with very small amount of soup/sauce and when I asked if it is possible to get more they charged me extra 4fr (just for 2 table spoons of sauce)! Seriously not for the money but that bad attitude though…felt really disappointed!

Trendy place with  fun decor, good service, and good food if you know  what to order. This is a "Korean" restaurant,  but not in the traditional  sense. The house special ramen is not a soup, but the combination of ramen noodles, Bulgari beef and veggies was yummy.  The bugogi main course is Bulgari beef, rice, and lettuce to make lettuce  wraps. We liked it. Sounds was not found  on the menu,  but they have it. Try it, you’ll  like it.

Delicious. The bibimbap has a bit of a kick (coming from someone who doesn't even use pepper) and is a good sized portion. The bulgogi comes with rice, lettuce leaves, and very mild kimchi that even I could handle. The chicken and fries are also very good, but not actually like I remember it being in Korea, so it's more of a basic option for anyone not really feeling Korean food. It's expensive, like everything else in Zurich, especially the drinks.

Fusion korean food. I really like the ambience, which is great thanks to the modern and rustic interior. I recommend the beef bowl it is the best tasting meat in a bowl I've ever had! Again the design of the restaurant is very cozy and creative!! I gave it 4 stars because it was a little pricey for what you get. But yeah highly recommended. One of the best korean in Zürich!!!
Great place to eat korean food.

The Bulbogi is nothing like what a Bulbogi is supposed to look like, it’s not about the quality of the ingredients, but a real Bulbogi, in Korea, comes in a large bowl with lots of stuff in it, not a bunch of meat in a small plate accompanied by a tiny amount of rice in another plate. And I lived in Korea a while. Very Disappointing. The Bibimbap is quite decent however.

Each time I order take away (in person) here it gets made quickly then left at the middle station to get cold for 5-10 minutes. Nobody takes responsibility for the quality when someone is standing waiting for takeaway.

Incredible venue with exquisite deco, top notch service and delicious food! Congrats on the team behind the concept, and those running it daily! Highly recommended for couples, business meals or family quality time.
Good and tasty Korean food, we ordered it through Uber eats! Namsan Chemistry and Gentle Monster are highly recommended!

Trendy new Korean fusion restaurant, with honey crispy KFC, ramen with kimchee, and a cool takeout setup.

It's in the new F building in Europaallee, and quite busy for only bring open 2 days with construction still going on around it.

They have Korean BBQ tables in the back.
I truly love this place: the food is yummilicious and the restaurant's interior is cozy. And Helmi is doing a great job in the service.
Nice tasty food with interesting flavors. Really like the interior. Service can be much improved though, crew is unorganized, food doesn’t come out together and you have to wait long.

Passed by last week and decided to call in. Stylish decor gives good first impression and menu is appealing. Only the brunch menu was available but still some nice-sounding options. Our waiter was welcoming and came quickly to take our drinks and food order. The spritzer drinks were very good - orange and carrot with ginger recommended. We ordered a couple of sharing dishes and each ordered an Egg Bun and were assured they'd all come together. As it happens the French fries with cheese (good!) and a starter arrived together. No problem apart from fries is a weird starter, but then we waited and waited for our mains. Eventually they arrived. Well one did - the chicken. The Egg Bun is a weird dish - a small loaf of a sweet bread with egg in it, soaking in a puddle of cheese sauce. On the side some badly cooked fried chicken. We were told the kitchen had messed the other one up so I ate my meal in front of my date while she watched. When her Egg Bun (consistently weird at least) with salmon turned up, I watched as she ate hers. Not ideal. The team did apologise and offer us a free drink as we'd finished ours while we waited for the main courses. They brought us the drink (we only asked for water!) after we'd finished eating. No one thought to clear our table or ask how the food was. After the meal, the cost of our spritzers was deducted from the bill and, while that is appreciated, I really can't recommend eating here when there are so many good restaurants in the area. It's a shame because the concept has potential, a better focus on customer service and quality over style is needed.
Recommended! Stylish place, tasty food and a lot of good drinks. This all for a reasonnable price for Zurich. Not a classic Corean but more of a fusion-style restaurant, nevertheless really yummy!
Amazing food and even more amazing service! Helmi was a rockstar! Definitely going back again.
The interior design is amazing, but that is all good I can tell about that restaurant.

If you are looking for Korean food, it's NOT the place. The ramen my daughter ordered was not made from broth but over salted B grade Japanese miso soup. The noodle (pic below) was far off from the real bulgogi (korean beef). Not for someone like proper Asian food.
Food is okay, not authentic but not terrible. Severely understaffed the service is not good.
very pleasant Korean restaurant. I recommend!

Even though our wait time was a bit long and there were slight confusions about our order, this is totally understandable since we visited during a busy time on a saturday evening. Staff was always very friendly and considerate despite their stress. Food was amazing. The Korean Chicken was particularly well done as well as the plant based version of the meats were stunning too. Highly recommendable! :)

Absolutely amazing food! What a fantastic spot! I might have to go back to Zurich from Geneva just to have this again. Also, one of the nicest waitresses one could ask for. Extremely friendly, helpful, and constantly smiling. Made the meal perfect. Thank you Miss Miu!
The food was great and the waiter was really friendly. Big ups to Jose, can't wait to go back

This hip and trendy restaurant serves up seriously tasty Korean cuisine. Eating outside has a very cosmopolitan vibe. If you are curious about different cuisines then you will like it here. The seasonings are subtle and the presentation is lovely. A good addition to the Zürich food scene.
Absolutely delicious food! The baos and the crispy chicken were excellent! And I loved the hibiscus Prosecco and the marshmallows, really original and very good! Highly recommended

You ever cook chicken and have it the next day, and the chicken's got this gamey, stale flavor and smell that's hard to describe but unmistakably the flavor of old refrigerated and reheated chicken? That's what we had. The chicken is not fried fresh and does not arrive to your table hot. It's not juicy either. Actually, a good word to describe it would be "dessicated" after being refried for what I can only guess is the 5th time that night. The flavor is also virtually nonexistent unless you were to absolutely drench it in sauce from a bottle (which is just watered-down gochujang--- what in the world?) yourself. Isn't the chicken supposed to be the house specialty? Ha. I hope others won't be put off real Korean fried chicken based on their experience here. I only gave two stars because the ambiance was fun, but this is very much a case of "not all that glitters is gold."
The food was great but there was a lot of confusion while getting a table which, long story short, made us lose about an hour.

Highly recommend this place. We visited there 2 times already and had great times. Highly recommend to try beef bibimbap. Place is really nice and food are so yummy. But service staffs are not really attentive. We had to wait a long time to order and asked for bill. Other than that Miss Miu is a great place to dine in.

Lovely place for dinner on a summer night sitting in the terrace. Bibimbap is delicious and bao buns for starters is a must for every visit.
I would recommend making reservation - when you show up spontaneously you are unlikely to get a table even though many are clearly free
The food & drinks are nice, however, the spiciness has been adjusted. I’m not sure whether it is possible to request the food to be spicier or not.

The staff manager was so rude and that definitely messed up my evening.
Nevertheless the food was good and the waitress did a great job.

Unfortunately a very poor experience. We were offered seats immediately but it took them 40 minutes just to take our order. Waiters were just chit-chatting with other clients or between each other. The food arrived reasonably quickly, but it all tasted cheap and generic, sorta badly done KFC level. The beer was good. I'd give 3 stars, but for 30chf for fried chicken wings with a bowl of french fries I had expected that you're serving something good.
Was a bit skeptical due to the average rating but this was fantastic. Great food and service with cozy ambience, cool paintings on the ceiling. Our server Micha was friendly and attentive.

Miss Miu is a asian restaurant just a few minutes walk from the Zurich mainstation. They offer a lot of drinks and a good variation of asian food. However both times I've been there the staff is really unfriendly. In addition, the prices are super high and the portions - at least for my taste in comparison with similar asian restaurants nearby - too small. Therefore if you're hungry, better go to another place, especially because it takes ages until you get your food.
P. S. Even the house ice tea with blueberries had old tasteless blueberries in it.

Pros:
- beautiful location which is a few minutes from the mainstation.

Cons:
- unfriendly staff
- high prices
- long waiting
- mediocre food
Way too sweet, no Kimchi sidings for Bibimbap, icon pot and Fried chicken. Not authentic for me, Bibimbap is so so, pot is not flavored enough, no spicy nor sour taste, starter chicken is too sweet.

The place looks extraordinary. So my expectations were possibly high as well. In my opinion, this is a good place. A good place, with a huge potential, that is not being fully realized! Service was friendly, not super attentive and looked a bit stressed/unhappy. But good and nothing to complain about.

Bibimbap was served without sauce. After asking for spicy sauce, a thai-style sweet and sour sauce that reminded me of the type of sauce you usually get for spring rolls was brought to the table. To me, this is a complete no-go with bibimbap! I can't understand why you wouldn't serve the/a original sauce instead. I understand, it's a fusion restaurant, but having a kinda normal bibimbap on the menu and serving it without sauce or sweet and sour sauce, respectively.... no way, that can't be good. Just my personal opinion.

The other dishes and the bibimbap itself tasted good! Kimchi was average, bit too sweet for me and tasted like Gojuchang. Portions were a bit small, to be honest. I liked the fried chicken bowl, although it came with two huge cauliflowers which were hard to finish for me. But, that's about personal preference. This time the sauce was tasty and fit the dish very well.

Overall, I really wish they would do just a bit better. This could be such a great spot in Zurich and become one of the best, if they were just to put this extra bit of effort and tried to be great and not just good. I see a missed opportunity so far but it's not too late! Just, please don't serve bibimbap with this kind of sweet and sour sauce.

I should have read the comment on Google Maps before I went there. I expected to get authentic Korean Fried Chicken there but it failed my expectation badly.

Korean fried chicken should be very saucy, full of sauce all over the fried chicken. But the fried chicken there is KFC style fried chicken with very little sauce (chicken on the edge didnt even get the sauce at all!). As other people commented, fried chicken was even toooo hard to eat! It was like a rock.

Drink was nice.

Kitchen had issues so we waited for 1 hour to get our food. When paying the bill, the waitress even prompt us to pay the tips. Overall, bad experience and I dont think I'll go back there again at all :(
Love it, so cozy, special and good food. Waiters are so nice and kind
A place that looks nice on Instagram, the food left a lot to be desired

Horrible customer service, I ordered via Uber eats but the main food is missing, call the restaurant no body answered, only transferred me to the company and the company told me they can Not re-deliver my missing food. I was waiting 1 hour for the delivery of my dinner and they even missing the main dish without re-delivery. Wasting my time.
Very nice. Good Bibimbap but specially good desserts.
I loved the fried chicken. Plus great service!
I had chimaek (fried chicken and beer) and it was super good! It reminded me of my time in Seoul. Highly recommended!
Very good food and lovely service by the incredible Helmi

Menu sounds ok, but all the food has a fast foody feeling and taste to it (bit oily). Certainly not Korean.
Some might like it, but unfortunately not my cup of tea.

Authentic yummy Korean dishes.

Nice atmosphere, friendly staff, and dogs are welcome :)

I don’t enjoy leaving this review, because I was really excited about this place initially.
Unfortunately, I will not return. Besides being surely on the high end of Zurich in regards to prices, the quality of the food does not match the price tag and most importantly - the meat here is quite sketchy, to put it politely.
We had the chicken wings and honestly, the meat was very chewy and had a strange aftertaste. Not just at the moment, but hours later, too. The seasoning/batter isn’t bad at all and it’s very disappointing that the meat itself was not good at all.
Fries were bland and felt almost “wet”, meaning they weren’t fresh or were at least sitting there for a bit.
To be clear, it wasn’t a one time experience.
Because the concept, the dishes and the interior left a great impression, we decided to try it again and ordered food to be delivered to our home - While you can’t expect the delivered food to be as “fresh” as the food you’ll get in the restaurant, the chicken again was not good and left me wondering if it was cooked all the way. I mean, come on - we all know that “medium rare” is not a great quality when it comes to ordering chicken.
To conclude - tried the place twice, and have to go back to the old saying: “Fool me once, shame on you. Fool me twice, shame on me”.
Sorry guys, absolutely unacceptable for the prices you’re charging!
ultra bland food, had to order salt to get any flavour out of the food, drinks were nice

Welcomed by swiss hospitality saying"at 19pm you need to be gone" just to let us then wait 20min for someone to take our order. 2of3 dishes were not good. Both dishes with chicken were dry and felt not fresh at all. The beef was good though.
Another 110Fr paid dissappoitment in FnB in this town. Sad but reality

I'm not able to judge if the food is authentic or not. However, it is undoubtedly very good! We have enjoyed our visit very much. The staff is very friendly and service surprisingly quicky. We will come back for sure!

I would not recommend! Very rude staff manager who did not like the idea that I came With child in a trolley saying that there is no room for it!
Set us in the worst place possible between two toilets and stairs. When the twenty other tables were empty for another 2h! Explaining that they are all booked out! In the end while the other tables were empty he ask us to free the table.  RUDE,mean, unprofessional mngr who made this experience unpleasant to say the least.(racist?)

Ordered food through uber eats , No utensils no tissues & no sides for Secret Japanese pavilion!
packing of food & presentation is one of main important thing

The service is pretty bad, if took about 25 minutes for someone to take our order, the food arrived 1.5 hours later and they still forgot half the order. Then food was salty, cold and stale. To make up for the bad food and service, we were offered one dessert instead of agreeing to take the food back. The worst restaurant in Zurich!!!
Nice service and staff. Food is good, not the best Korean I've had but decent enough. Shaved ice was melting a bit when it arrived.
Food, ambiance, and service were all pleasent. I suggest everyone to try the special coctails. We look forward to go again.
Good service, appreciate the unlimited kimchi. The plates are a little on the heavy side with sauces and oil. Standard Zurich prices (aka not cheap)
Great food. I had the cauliflower dish, it was really nice.

Ordered the Bibimbap with beef. When the bowl came it was hardly sizzeling and at the bottom there was a lot of liquid. Temperature to low to fry the rice or the egg. So the whole bowl was very soggy.

The flavor is mediocore, the beef seems to be marinated veal that does not really go well with the rest of the flavors. There is no kimchi included or any little sidedishes as its supposed to be.

At over 30 Swiss Franc for such a bowl it is definately way overpriced. The size of the portion is okay.

I'm not the type to write bad reviews as I usually inform staff on site about my negative experiences, but I'll make an exception for Miss Miu. <3

Second time eating here, second time a screw up. First time I ordered a vegan soup - there was egg in there. No apologies, just blamed it on the kitchen. This time my sister and I waited 1 1/2 for our lunch. It wasn't busy either. When I asked where our food was the waitress blamed it on the communication between service staff and kitchen. Honestly, she should have noticed us waiting and informed us or at least asked if we had received our food yet, but she didn't. When we finally received our food it was cold and the bibimbap was burnt. So she obviously just forgot about it and couldn't own up to her mistake. She offered a side on the house but dishonesty and cowardice couldn't make up for anything. Sorry.

Both the times I visited the food was bland and/or pretty basic. Came by because both times it was a Sunday and we all know how in Switzerland everything's closed on Sundays. Pretty expensive for what it is. Pretty pretentious interior decoration. Super try hard.

Wouldn't recommed to anyone.
Food is nice and atmosphere is as well. However, the portions are a bit small. Even at lunch time the prices are a bit hefty. 40 CHF for proper lunch.
Horrible service, and quite expensive. Not recommended as a good Korean option among many other places which Zurich has to offer.

Great place. We live 10 meters from here, and it became my snackbar. inside interior is cool, hip, contemporary. Nice outside on Europaallee with sun until about 19.00.  Get the bibimbap planted chicken.
We never make reservations (but we also go on these random Tuesdays etc. For the weekend, i would recommend make a reservatio)
I enjoyed the atmosphere and the food. Nice place to go close to HB

The food was decent and nicely presented.
They have a good selection of Asian beers and signature cocktails of the house.
The staff was very nice and competent.
The only thing was that our main dishes didn’t arrive at the same time, so for some people it already started getting cold while we were waiting for the others. I don’t know if this happens more often.
The hidden bar is nice and the staff there very attentive. Good cocktails!
Excellent service and food every time!!
Korean bbq. Interesting expierence and taste. Ok service. Social aspect.
Vegan chicken is delicious, portions are big - a lot of fat, so a bit heavy on the stomach. Ambiente is great too.
Everything is great but there are more authentic places in ZH

Very bad experience - reservation got mixed up (we booked for Friday, restaurant noted it down for Saturday), then we had to wait 1.5h for a table and then another 1.5h (!) to get the food. In the meantime, one of the waitresses tried twice to bring us food which was probably for other guests and was rather resistant to understand the fact that it's not what we have ordered. Some of dishes we had ordered never came, but they got included in the bill anyway. Correction of the bill took another 0.5h...  2 stars (and not 1!) only because most of the staff was rather friendly and food that managed to arrive was indeed tasty.
The place and menu looks great. The food is very mediocre. Their drinks menu is alright.
The cauliflower is good but the lack of gluten free options is kind of disappointing
Not very flavorful. It's fine if you're in a pinch.

Barbecue is amazing !
Put it on your to do list :)
The food is amazing HOWEVER table service could be waaaay better specially on sundays. Not too crowded and took me 20 minutes to order one single beer 🥺…

Our go-to or rather deliver-home-place for a quick Korean style soul food fix.
Staff ranged from wholesome and fast to forgetful and annoyed.
Hopefully, we soon can go and try the Korean BBQ!

Lovely service and really tasty. Got the Bibimbap and was delicious spicy but not too much!
Dog friendly!

The atmosphere staff and especially decoration is nice.
The food is well designed.
But the taste is soso and it's not totally real Korean food....

The food is absolutely amazing and the drinks too! The shrimp mandus and the smoked salmon sushi are out of this world! the special Hugo and the mocktails are delicious as well. The location looks pretty fancy too. Great for a girls night out or for a less common dinner.
Unhygienic. Rude staff, front of house.  Average, at best, food.

My food was good and I personally had a good experience. My friend however waited so long for his Ramen and until it came, I was already done with my food. His Ramen also had no taste which was kind of dissapointing.
There wasn't enough staff and I feel like the preparation for food in the kitchen could've been more organized. We were not the only one that evening who received their food so late, but also the table next to ours.

The restaurant has a nice ambience, very original, even though the mix of different styles can result a bit chaotic. The night we had dinner, the service was really slow. We were 5 people and each of us got the food on different times, two of us had to wait almost 40 minutes for their plate while the others already finished eating. Apparently there was a problem in the kitchen, but still it was kind of disappointing. The food was good, typical Zürich prices.
Amazing!!!! Service was great our waiter was so fun. The deco gave me life. I can't wait to go back and swing on the red feathers 🙌🙌👍👍
Warm service, dear Helmi, thank you :)!

Don't go there if you want to have just a drink,  not even in less rush hours! After sitting for like 20 minutes I could finally order. After waiting for another 10 minutes I left the place. This is the second time that I got this terrible service at Mis Miu. Probably the last time as well ;).

Never been to South Korea, but I have to say that I love their shaved ice cream! I didn’t know it before and it is like very tasty snow melting in your mouth. I have been to Miss Miu in two occasions and both times were amazing :)
My husband, on the other hand, likes it even more! As the is a great option for business’ lunches & dinners. The food and drinks are great and nicely presented. The service guys are friendly. The place is beautifully decorated, in fact there are several deco-concepts within the place! My fave is the back room because it is full of plants and you can do a Korean BBQ!

Took a long time to get food. Then we didn’t get food at the same time. I had the tonkatsu but it was really a curry. I didn’t like it at all. We were only asked for additional drinks until after we ordered dessert. Dessert was good. The decor was awesome.

Was very surprised by this restaurant. It doesn't try too hard being foreign, the interior is designed very well. Service was good and fast. Had a soup with ramen and it was amazing. The bowl was big and they put in a lot of meat&ramen. Prices are more than fair. Definitely. Recommend this one.

Went with family for Korean BBQ there. Sadly, the experience didn't had the feeling of "Korean BBQ" - it felt more like a ordinary kitchen/home table grill. The grill itself was just a heated plate and sadly not a charcoal (probably due regulation). The rice was very dry and felt like it was just kept hot for several hours without adding any water to keep it a bit moist.

Service was friendly and attentive! We were also able to order from the normal menu that usually is only available for non-BBQ customers.

However, we probably won't visit the restaurant again - nothing really felt like Korean and it is kinda overpriced for what you get.

One of the best korean restaurants so far! You should try the dim sum and their sushi.
Noodle bowls are fabulous!
Food will be served as fresh as possible (à la minute) + you will get still mineral water (filtered tap water) for free. I recommend this place 100%!

I ordered delivery food from here and am suffering from some serious intestinal distress. Not sure if it was the "Naughty Midnight Touch" chicken or the "Silim Lights" bibimbap,  but the last 24 hours have been miserable.

2 days ago, I ordered the above for dinner and felt pretty much fine afterwards. The morning of the next day I noticed I wasn't hungry at all. By lunch time I didn't want to eat anything. In the afternoon my abdomen started cramping and I became really nauseous, even getting random shivers. I barely made it home and spent the rest of the day in bed, getting through the pain. Finally fell asleep at 3-4am.

It's been >24 hours since the first symptoms and I can still not bring myself to eat.

Good portions.  I liked my Bibimbap. It’s not like in Korea,  that’s asking for too much but it’s good enough.   Sevice is on the slow side but it’s friendly  and it’s okay because it’s Friday evening and we were just hanging out with the girl friends.  I like the decor.  I will come back!

Great food but expensive even for Zurich standards.

Don't order Makgeolli if you don't know how it tastes or atleast don't order the 7.5 dl alone

Tasty food and generous on the portion size (at least for bibimbap). It's definitely not authentic korean cuisine though, more of a westernized take on it.

Disappointed by the service though. It took a while to get our orders taken, then the food didn't arrive all at the same time.
Good but not as good as I had hoped. It's a fun location, friendly staff. But the food was just average in my opinion.
good food - always crowded

Congratulations. After 40 minutes of waiting in burning sun we were informed that our order has been lost and that we could get complimentary drinks as compensation. Yeah, sure. We went to eat in a quicker place.
Really enjoyed the food! Staff were super friendly. Will definitely visit again!

i love korean foods and when this new Korean restaurant opened my husband suggested that we should try it. We went there just one week after the opening and to be honest, if I havent tried korean food, I would give this restaurant a 5 star. I am giving 5 star to the customer service, waiters were very attentive and know what they are doing. 4 star for the restaurant I like how they designed the place cozy and has a nice atmosphere but it didnt have any tinge of Korean vibe in it. And unfortunately, I am only giving the food a 3.5. I ordered beef Bulgogi and although it was delicious, I didnt feel the right Bulgogi taste. The cabbage kimchi was not fermented and I think it doesnt have any shrimp paste or fish sauce because it didnt have this umami taste and  it almost doesnt have a smell (yes kimchi has a strong smell if you are not use to it). The ramen was good , the noodles were perfect too. In all fairness the Homemade ice tea and calamnsi juice were refreshingly delicous. I will give another try in 3 months maybe there will be an improvement.

Fantastic service, atmosphere and food. The staff was friendly and accommodating, food was excellent and the price was very reasonable.

A special thank you to Julio from the bar and Jakob from the restaurant.

Wow. I don't even know if disappointing is the right word for what I experienced today.
To begin with I work as a waitress myself for more than 10years now and I understand when staff has to deal with stressful situations during lunch time.. but I arrived quite at the end of the busy lunch and there were barely any new tables coming after me..

So.. I arrived, I was alone and got a table RIGHT in front of the entrence outside on the terrace.. so staff kept walking in- and outside and passed my table..
They (about 4 different waiter outside) often looked at me but no one approached me.. after 25min of waiting (as I dont want to be stressy and still hoped for any kind of attention aaand also because I couldnt believe that I really didnt even get a menu yet) ... I had to asked for the menu myself.. the few tables that arrived after me already had drinks on their tables and ordered... I got more and more frustrated but as I was waiting for one of the chefs (who is an old friend of mine) to go on his break so we can spend it together I kept on waiting to get served. Even the chef himself asked the waiters to serve me but not even then anybody came up to me.. after he joined my still empty table, I got finally asked if I have already decided (at that point I have been sitting at that table for 40min .. and again .. right in front of the entrance .. not even a drink on my table.. each of them passed me every 2 Minutes)
50min in this whole scenario I got my drink... ONE HOUR at the table .. I got my entree .. my friend already had to leave as his break was over..

So end of the story was.. I had to watch him eating his staff food while I was still waiting .. then had to eat alone and watch the waiter staff going to their breaks and leave the staff (the only nice lady that even recognised me) coming to work during their breaks and clean up their mess which they left behind and do all the mise en place which they were supposed to do ..

Also the menu was hard to read and hard to figure out what they are even talking about in their descriptions..

Way too expensive for the basic flavours (I had to add heaps of chilli sauce to even make my soup taske like something)

All in all .. pur frustration .. sadly wont come back even the kitchen used to be really good but when the service is THAT bad .. the best food wont taste good anymore :(

Great service and excellent food choice, the variety of vegetarian and vegan options were amazing.

One of the nicest places I've been to in Zurich in terms of atmosphere, service and food choice.
We ordered two cocktails. We were assured couple times by two waiters that we will receive our order 'soon'. After 1h 10min we lost our patience and left without getting anything.
Nice atmosphere, great drinks. food is OK.
Delicious Food and great atmosphere, 5/5 stars there. When we ordered as a group of 5 we were not served together and also the second drinks we ordered took too long. Therefore 4/5 Stars

I ordered take away online. The pick up experience is terrible. Very unfriendly, unorganized and untrained staff. They all look like it’s their first day and they have no clue about anything. Not even the basic welcoming skills. No smile, no hello, it’s an absolute catastrophe from the management side to let people work like that. We will obviously never come back. Even one star is too much.

One of the worst service experiences ever. We were a group of 5 and it took us several attempts at "sorry, we'd like to order" until we got the first dialog with a waiter after 20min. Adding orders was nearly impossible as nobody felt responsible. Half of the stuff we ordered was forgotten. Empty plates or glasses weren't picked up at all. The billing system was broken as well on top of everything else. I could go on and on. Food was ok, though mostly too fat and underseasoned. A very generous two stars.
I love it the, very niece ambiance and yummy barbecue 🥰
Awesome Bibimbap and the angry chicken is very tasty too! The interieur is very cool too.

Zurich needs more places like this. There is a really cool, fun atmosphere, even in the bathrooms where each stall has its own disco ball! One thing that's particularly great is that they gladly accept walk-ins and if there is a wait, they will invite you to do so in the speakeasy hidden in the back. The food is Korean fusion, and the menu is expansive. I have yet to try something I didn't like, but some favorites are the fried tofu, Korean fried chicken/cauliflower, bulgogi gimbap, mazemen noodles, and of course bibimbap. Their kimchi sampler at the beginning of the meal is fantastic as well. This is a great place for groups, but it also works well as a date spot. If you want takeaway, you can order it at kiosks at the entrance, or you can order online for home delivery. The service is good and the servers are a lot of fun... it's just a great experience from start to finish!

One the biggest disappointment so far. Overall this restaurant is not worth money. Beside the interior, everything else was mediocre at best. Even the service was really poor.

We ordered several dishes and non of them tased authentic.

Below some examples:

- The crust of the Korean Fried Chicken (Name on the menu Lon Hongdae Nights) was dry an hard. Additionally it lacks the taste, juiciness and the sauce which make common KFC so special.

- Bulgogi (Awoo Karaoke) was also too dry and we exchanged it for another dish

- The broth of the vegan iron pot (Us on Earth) lacks clearly the typical korean spices.

- Bibimbap was ok and the beef was really tender, but it lacks the seasoning (e.g. kimchi). The deal breaker for me was however the additional charge on the bibimbap sauce, which is always included in any authentic bibimbap dish.

If you care about authentic korean food, then this place is not for you. There are better options in Zurich (e.g. Mi Mi Sa)

We went for the korean bbq. It's a fusion restaurant, so the meat and the sides are different from a traditional korean restaurant, but still very tasty. The staff is a little inexperienced but they are very friendly and ask if everything is good. Very pleasant experience.

Great food and very nice ambiance. Service of the food was super fast, but unfortunately we had to wait long for our drink orders, which were waiting at the bar to be served for over 10 mins. Therefore no 5 stars.

If you are looking for authentic Korean dishes, you'd better go to Misoga at Hegibachplatz. At Miss Miu the dishes seemed to be made for Europeans who can't or don't eat spicy food. The staff were very friendly and the place itself was excellent. I will have to try the BBQ dishes next time to make up my mind whether I want to go back there.
Definitely one of best ramen in Zürich city. Worth visiting!

This was nice, though they had some issues here and there (3 different waiters asked us to move away from our table saying it was reserved - yes, it was, for us LOL). Food was good, but not EPIC. We really enjoyed the atmosphere and decor, though! APPROVED, I recommend. :-)

Location is great and interior is fun.
Food is not authentic Korean and the taste is also so so. (I liked the dessert though.)
Service is friendly but chaotic(They often forget the order).

Love Europaallee and its new developments and stores and restaurants.  Miss Miu has a very instragrammable interior.  The food is not bad, but there is a lack of many interesting traditional Korea dishes.  Nevertheless it is worth a visit.

At present, I would give Miss Miu 3 stars (average). The gin tonic was really good and well priced. The food was 50/50 on taste for 4 people. It could use more spice, kimchi portions could be larger. Service has improved from complaints from other users. I do find it unacceptable that there was only one gluten-free option on the menu - Bibimbap. I would suggest that the kitchen use gluten-free soya sauce for marinating as almost no one can taste the difference.

The Bibimbap is quite tasty and big! The tonkatsu curry is also good and less food.
Other dishes I've tried were okay but not great.
There is sometimes a wait.

My first Korean restaurant and I like it a lot. Friendly staff, delicious food.. great atmosphere.
It feels like a bit more modern than traditional but I like it.
Very nice starters, really super decoration and atmosphere. Only 3 stars because main course collyflower drowned in sauce and not as crunchy as expected.
Good service, fast order processing, delicious food (though the taste worsened a bit during the last year imo).

This place is pretty horrible. It should not be called a Korean restaurant. Any Korean person would be ashamed of it. It's unpersonal, huge. Long wait for the food. Not friendly staff. The food was tasteless. I never wrote a restaurant review in my life for a restaurant, but this was so bad I had to say something....
Very cool decoration, and delicious drinks. It's a nice experience.
always very delicious food and great options especially for vegans!
Good food and the staff is great 👍
Delicious Food!! Friendly Staff, comfortable and nicely decorated interio!! Definitely recommend. You will go there again and again

We had awesome experience. Had gone for family dinner, not only food and drinks were excellent, they surprised us with birthday treat.
Thank you Miu team.

Sunday lunch.
Service is not well trained . Young girl waitress was lost!!
She forgot to order our food. We could not have waisted more time then what we did. 1 hour of waiting for nothing.
I don’t think I will go again.
No apologies or something. We payed for our wine (which we were waiting also very long )
And left

waited 20 min for my take out food. people that came after me got served first. food was completely cold when i finally got it. food was not on the level as it usually is. the chefs in the open kitchen wer fooling around the whole time i was waiting. real bummer guys.

This place is horrible. I knew about because I order a lot of food from it online and the food was nice but... When me and my friend visited this place it turned out very dirty. Many tables were not cleaned up and things generally looked not very clean. After 5 minutes we left without even trying food.

The food is okay and it takes really long... Also the stuff didn't knew what i was ordering even though it was on the menu card. I ordered maekju (soju with beer) and they brought it without the soju.
Great choice of really good food. Interesting choice of drinks and a slightly limited dessert menu. Very cool interior design. Bottomline, thumbs up!
Fun restaurant with great food and interesting decor. Newly opened and the service staff isn't perfect yet. But the food is great, so I'll be back for sure and hope the service is better :-)
Beautiful place and delicious Korean food! Recommended :-)

Great Korean restaurant where you find fun Korean food and atmosphere. It’s just a few minutes from HB and there are some interesting shops nearby. Good place to go after work or with friends on the weekend.
Nice food and very central place
Went here for lunch. The food was tasty and portions were decently sized. Nicely set up place. I would go back for the BBQ next time.

Unfortunately I was a bit disappointed with the vegi noodle soup. It was literally a pot of noodles in broth with almost no vegetables. Quite dull and not worth the money.  The sharing dishes seemed a better choice.
Great ramen, super quick and friendly service.
Beautiful restaurant. The food might be good for people who have never had authentic Korean food before but for me, the food was a disappointment.
Great food and drinks selection, loved the korean specialties and korean beers
bloody good food yeah!

I am 100% SURE that the owner is not Korean. Weird taste with lack of quality, strange menu and interior.....well..but staffs are helpful though.
It was very very interesting experience for me..lol
A must for corean food in Zürich
Food was good, but do not expect authentic Korean food. This is a fusion restaurant. I wish they also advertised it as such.
Offers a yummy Sushi and Korean culinary experience at only a stone throw from HB Zurich. Pleasant place to nibble and have a city break.
Amazing dinner. Love the fusion style and the ambience. Stuff super lovely. Recommended
Great food and cool decor. Reservation recommend!
I ordered a ramen with Uber Eats. I have never had something so bad in my life, and the noodles were all glued together in a ball.
Delicious vegi bento box
Very nice restaurant, in the center of Zürich (Europaallee). I picked the Bibimbap Lunch Special and it was delicious. Completely recommended
best Korean food and great service

I am disappointed,Bao Buns were ok,but other food was super greasy,deep fried and too salty.We were excited to go there and try food but I doubt we will return.The restaurant itself has a very nice ambiance and interior.
Great food, friendly stuff and pleasant outdoor space!

The food is reaally good but the service....
5 stars for the food
4 stars for the place cus it looks great
2 stars cus of technical problems with the self ordering
1 star cus of the service

This is not an authentic korean restaurant. Please do not think this is how korean food tastes after you visiting this place ;) we were 6 people and I tried several food and somehow all food was lacking some taste...
Decoration of this place is peculiar, food is great, dessert are unique. The whole place is surprising.

The staff is very friendly but the manager assistant !!!!! She did the wrong receipt but super rude to us and doesn’t want to accept her mistakes ! The food is 50% Swiss 50% Korean !!!
She is super lout when she is talking .... really bothered ...
Very delicious food, Korean fried chicken is honey glazed AF. Friendly staff and wonderful ambience ! Recommended !
Great food! Always delicious.
Nothing special except the girl I was with
Food was good, wine was insane, only the stuff seemed a bit chaotic running around and forgetting orders.
Food very good, unfortunately service let’s it down each time !
Food and drinks are very good from taste to presentation. A little understaffed, though.

(Translated by Google) I went here twice for dinner.
++: Nice and modern atmosphere, I'm Asian myself, I think it's cool that there are Asian restaurants that don't look blatantly “typically Asian”. No typical restaurant in Asia would be “decorated” with dragons, lanterns or Buddhas.
+/-: The food itself was half good, half bad. Gimbap, Mandu and Popped Ice were really good.
Iron Pot was too salty for me both times and once the gas stove didn't work properly, which I found annoying as a guest. But what I liked the least are the kimchi / carrots, etc. they just don’t taste Korean at all and you could really tell that the marinade (or the taste) only stayed on the surface. But they were free, I thought it was a shame, they made a bad impression on me ...
In general, I would recommend Miss Miu as a modern restaurant with "Asian Fusioned Kitchen" and not as a restaurant with authentic, original Korean cuisine.

(Translated by Google) To call this restaurant a Korean restaurant is a joke!
Every Korean food stall in Seoul is better than this restaurant!

If you only look at the map, you realize that there is something wrong. Who believes that this is authentic food, when the food is touted as Korea Train Express, Gangnam Downstairs or as DMZ Koridoors.
This is like praising a Jungfraujoch chocolate toast as a Swiss specialty abroad.

Now for dinner:

We had mandus, gimbap and kimchi.

The kimchi was absolutely underground. The kimchi smelled musty, had no acid, let alone the sharpness.

The gimbap does not deserve the name Gimbap. Actually, it should not be difficult to prepare a gimbap, because this is a Korean snack, which is especially loved by children and every Korean knows how to prepare it.
But I believe that no Korean would call this dish Gimbap.

The vegetarian mandus were edible. I would not call her Korean. They were just dumplings with a boring filling.

Another small note:
I have lived in Korea for a long time and I love Korean food above all else.

(Original)
Dieses Restaurant als ein koreanisches Restaurant zu bezeichnen ist ein Witz!
Jede koreanische Garküche in Seoul, ist besser, als dieses Restaurant!

Wenn man nur schon in die Karte sieht, erkennt man, dass da was nicht stimmen kann. Wer glaubt schon, dass es sich um authentisches Essen handelt, wenn die Speisen als Korea Train Express, Gangnam Downstairs oder als DMZ Koridoors angepriesen werden.
Dies ist etwa so, als würde man im Ausland, eine Jungfraujoch-Schokoladenrösti, als schweizerische Spezialität anpreisen.

Nun zum Essen:

Wir hatten Mandus, Gimbap und Kimchi.

Der Kimchi war absolut unterirdisch. Der Kimchi roch modrig, hatte keine säure, geschweige dem Schärfe.

Das Gimbap verdient den Namen Gimbap nicht. Eigentlich sollte es ja nicht schwierig sein, ein Gimbap zuzubereiten, denn dies ist ein koreanischer Snack, der vor allem von Kindern geliebt wird und jeder Koreaner weiss wie man es zubereitet.
Ich glaube aber, dass kein Koreaner diese Speise als Gimbap bezeichnen würde.

Die vegetarischen Mandus waren essbar. Ich würde sie aber nicht als koreanisch bezeichnen. Es waren einfach Teigtaschen mit einer langweiligen Füllung.

Noch eine kleine Randbemerkung:
Ich habe längere Zeit in Korea gelebt und ich liebe koreanisches Essen über alles.
